This cleary is the best game on Steam. It shows that Valve truly are the best when it comes to game makin. I Played the first portal which i enjoyed so when i head that portal 2 was going to be more story based i could not wait to play it. It is truly one of the best games on pc and if you havent played it you should. It keeps you occupied whislt giggling along the way and keeping you focused on solving puzzles. Co-op proves very handy too as it can be played with friends and family which will also keep you focused, again keeping you entertained and giggling along the way. The story is well played out and you will get a sense of how the Half-Life story ends up in portal and if you have played Half-Life 2 episode two you will understand this too.
Stupendous storyline with amazing graphics, and tantalizingly difficult puzzle gameplay.

10/10
Cuando llego a mis manos pensé que era un juego de puzzles cualquiera sin ningún tipo de historia. A medida que lo juegas la música, la propia historia y lo bien ambientado que está te siguen dando la energía mental suficiente para poder seguir resolviendo los desafiantes puzzles que Portal 2 te propone. 
Es más, una vez que acaba la historia principal, tienes miles de niveles más hechos por la comunidad y una campaña cooperativa imprescindible.
El juego de puzzles definitivo.

Aconsejo jugar al Portal 1 antes, para notar las diferencias y apreciar la historia.

PROS:

-Excelentes puzzles que te hacen partirte la cabeza.

-Revela la historia detrás de Aperture Science

-Mucho humor

-Diversión sin parar.

CONS:

-No hay pastel :P

NO HAY CONTRAS COMPRA ESTE MALDITO JUEGO IDIOTA!!

No cabe ninguna duda, este juego es demasiado bueno.
Al principio no parecería muy largo, con dos campañas (un jugador y cooperativo), pero ahí esta el Workshop y la comunidad haciando todo el tiempo cámaras nuevas, esta es una de las mejores inversiones que podeis hacer en Steam.

10/10, all class. Easily in my top 3 games of all time, a genius game. The perplexing puzzles and thoughtful level design make this game so memorable. Portal 2, created by Valve, is a sequel to the first game, Portal. With so far 6 hours on record, I have beaten the single player campaign. The co-op campaign will be played when I aquire friends. I reccomend you find a friend to play with before buying.

If you liked Portal 1, you'll love Portal 2. Portal 2 is everything Portal 1 was times three: 3 times the number of rooms, 3 times the number of gadgets, and 3 times more fun wrapped into a storyline of 9 well-thought out chapters.

The game begins like Portal 1, but in a distant future where Aperture has become derelict and in disrepair. Chell is revived by the core named Wheatley, wonderfully voiced by Stephen Merchant. She is brought through a series of chambers that begins similar to Portal 1, but soon diverges into new challenges with new devices. She is then brought through a history of crude alpha, beta, and gamma test chambers that originate from Aperture's beginnings in the 1950's through the 1980's, introducing us to three new devices: boucing, accelerating, and portaling paint. She is then led through a series of newly created chambers that make use of the new paints, as well a new launcher, light walls, and levitators.

Whereas you could spend a day solving Portal 1, you could become absorbed for a week solving Portal 2. Like Portal 1, Portal 2 will keep you engrossed in the gameplay and wanting more... a completely enjoyable experience.
Portal 2 improves 100% over Portal 1 but it felt like a Portal1 clone to me, but I will still reommend this to everybody.

This game is great. As its own game, it is more than adequate, and I thoroughly enjoyed myself. The addition of coop mode can lead to hilarious and frustrating moments. This game, however isn't alone, and had the practically insurmountable task of meeting the level of quality of the first game, which it comes extremely close to doing. As it is, however, I would strongly reccomend this to anybody and everybody.

[b]PROS: [/b]This game is the golden example as to how to make a sequel. It took everything great about the previous game and added onto it. Great controls, story, gameplay, and audio all made even better than before. Overall game-time has been lengthened greatly, especially with the addition of multiplayer which is an absolute blast with strong replayability. The multiplayer itself has built-in mic capabilities and lots of communication tools, giving players of any skill a fair shot at succeeding.

[b]CONS: [/b]Later levels of [spoiler]old Aperture[/spoiler] may be off-putting in appearances to some. The addition of various gels come fast and are a little overwhelming, but you eventually adjust. Due to the nature of the late levels being used to tell lore, there's not as many easter eggs in the main game! This is a bit disappointing, due to what we know about [spoiler]Half-Life 3.[/spoiler] It's also a fair amount easier than Portal 1.

[b]WORTH: [/b]This game goes on sale with some frequency, so it'd be wise to wait for one of the many times in the year the game goes down to 80% off. The big thing is buying the two pack-- the multiplayer expands upon the story of Portal 2, has achievements, works wonderfully and is a delightful experience for two players. You won't regret springing for the second copy!

[b][u]OVERALL: [/u][/b]There is no reason to not have played this and the original Portal, as it's an iconic series that goes on steep sales often. Portal 2 an excellent continuation of the story and a testament to Valve's strength as a developer.

Single handedly one of the best linear nartives in all of gaming history. The source engine has never looked, or sounded better. Wonderful atmosphere, passionate design, and brilliant story telling. Pair the Portal series with the Half-Life series and you've got the most thrilling first person experience money can buy. Portal's intuitive and exciting "Portal" and "Gel" mechanics are both inovative and revolutionary; this level of originality is very uncommon in AAA titles, and Valve nailed it. There is a reason why Portal 2 is my favorite game of all time.

Would recommend 9/10
